intro: Wahlenbergia krebsii subsp. krebsii, commonly known as the coastal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in coastal sand dunes and rocky habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Wahlenbergia krebsii subsp. krebsii is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
